messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What should the Keeper do if the investigators get too deep in the scenario?
Either break off play or improvise.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the oldest and strongest kind of fear, according to H.P. Lovecraft?
Fear of the unknown.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can utilizing Lovecraftian themes help design scenarios and games of Call of Cthulhu?
It can help imbue games with an undercurrent of Lovecraftian horror.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why is fear of the unknown significant, according to H.P. Lovecraft?
It is the oldest and strongest emotion of mankind.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why does the Keeper need to either break off play or improvise in scenarios?
The Keeper needs to either break off play or improvise when the investigators get too deep, and the Keeper cannot make scenarios infinitely deep and complex.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the oldest and strongest emotion of mankind, according to H.P. Lovecraft?
Fear
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a central tenet presented in nearly all of Lovecraft's fiction?
Fear of the unknown
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the situation of the investigators in the scenario?
They are cut off from civilization with no one who will come to their aid, and are the 'outsiders'
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a characteristic of investigators in the story?
They are the 'outsiders'
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a potential outcome of delving into forbidden knowledge?
Knowledge causes pain, sorrow, and death.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a potential benefit of unraveling the mystery in the game?
Part of the horror (and fun) comes from unraveling the mystery and facing up to the big revelation.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do investigators typically communicate during the investigation?
They are cut off from civilization with no phones or safety.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the advice given for dealing with potentially disturbing secrets in the text?
Better they are destroyed or kept hidden lest some fool messes with things best left sleeping.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the context for the realization of being affected by something in the text?
The realization that something has affected you, be it alien implants, false memories, or dark truths
You are a helpful assistant.
What is part of the horror and fun in the Call of Cthulhu game, according to the text?
Part of the horror (and fun) comes from unraveling the mystery and facing up to the big revelation.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a suggested reading for players of the Call of Cthulhu game, according to the text?
The Case of Charles Dexter Ward, The Call of Cthulhu
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the suggested reading for Call of Cthulhu?
The Case of Charles Dexter Ward, The Call of Cthulhu
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a useful backdrop to a scenario in Call of Cthulhu?
A pervading sense of corruption, in mind and body
You are a helpful assistant.
How can keepers make the theme of corruption personal?
By making it personal, for example, the slow developing and frightening metamorphosis of an investigator into a deep one (the Innsmouth taint)
You are a helpful assistant.
What may provoke Sanity point loss for the investigator?
Alterations in appearance and habits over time
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the effect of alterations in appearance and habits on the investigators and those around them?
Sanity point loss for the investigators as well as those around them.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do family bloodlines affect the investigators?
They carry 'memories' and taints from their forebears.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the effect of the taints and 'memories' on the investigators?
They may experience Sanity point loss.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to the investigators if they are descendants of those who committed evil crimes?
They cannot escape the stain of evil crimes committed by their forebears.
